intro: Cacalia debilis, commonly known as the slender cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stem and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Cacalia debilis is often found in California and is considered a rare and endemic species.
